text: Calculate the total resistance of the shown resistor network in Ohm, round to the nearest one.

The schematic shows an analog input frontend.All components, including operational amplifiers and diodes, are to be considered ideal. The ideal diode has a forward voltage of 0.6 V at any current and no leakage current in reverse direction at any voltage. The ideal operational amplifier has no input bias current, no input offset voltage Vout in mV for Vin=18mV, R=1kOhm, 3R= 3*R and C=197nF in steady state, round to the nearest one.
According to the rules EV 5.4.2 and EV 5.4.3, which of the following statements is currect regarding the integration of the Low Voltage System (LVS) into the TSAV?

answer_options.answer_text: The LVS may only be integrated into the TSAC if this is absolutely necessary for the operation of the AIRs, TS DC/DC converters and other specific components
The LVS may be integrated into the TSAC without restrictions as long as all components comply with the safety standards
The LVS must be fully integrated into he TSAC to simplify assembly
The LVS must be completely disconnected from the TSAC to minimise the risk of short circuits

answers.answer_text: The LVS may only be integrated into the TSAC if this is absolutely necessary for the operation of the AIRs, TS DC/DC converters and other specific components
The LVS may be integrated into the TSAC without restrictions as long as all components comply with the safety standards
The LVS must be fully integrated into he TSAC to simplify assembly
The LVS must be completely disconnected from the TSAC to minimise the risk of short circuits

text:
You own a live telemetry system having a battery powered ground station. The ground station draws a constant current of 4.2 A at a supply voltage of 24 V. Each battery pack has 10 Ah, is fully charged and can be discharged to 14 %. Assume the battery voltage to be constantly 24 V regardless of the state of charge.

What is the minimum number of whole battery packs required for a test day of 8 hours?

Assume a shunt resistor having the following parameters:
- resistance of 1 Omega at 20°C
- max. continuous power dissipation of 250W
- thermal resistance to ambient of 1 K/W
- resistance thermal coefficient of  10  ppm/K
- ambient temperature constantly 25°C

What is the measured voltage across the resistor when a current of 13A is continuously applied? Assume steady state.
Enter your answer in mV, round to the nearest one.
